website_summaries.verdict: The 9th version of the Saucony Guide was able to deliver great service to a lot of runners who needed support and stability for their activities on the pavement. They lauded its responsive and reliable components. Basically, they were satisfied with it. But such wasn’t the case for a few disgruntled consumers who thought that it some of its parts weren’t durable or agreeable to their feet.
pros: A lot of runners welcomed the eye-catching color schemes of the Saucony Guide 9
Numerous testers reported that this shoe didn’t feel tight or restrictive
for them, it was true to its size
The stability feature was reliable and not intrusive, according to several runners
Those who have tried it indicated that the cushioning system of this shoe felt adequately responsive
Many consumers appreciated the traction given by the rubber outsole unit
Several testers commented that they were able to get great value for its price
they liked the quality of this version
The durability of the Guide 9 was lauded and commended
Some testers who tended to experience foot pain while running didn’t complain of such when wearing this shoe
The toe box was roomy enough to accommodate natural toe-splaying, wrote several runners
cons: After only a few months of use, the upper unit’s fabric tore off on a tester
According to several runners, the heel area of cushioning system broke down and rendered the platform unstable
The fabric in the rear section of the upper tended to rub against the skin of some runners, causing some irritation

customer_reviews.title: which seems like a short amount time
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Guide 9s, so I knew what to expect. My first pair lasted around three months, which seems like a short amount time, however I lost thirty pounds during that period, with these shoes on my feet the whole time. These shoes offer exceptional support and comfort, especially for larger folks. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Chickenlips

customer_reviews.title: Ran a marathon last year in mizuno wave inspire 11s ...
customer_reviews.text: Ran a marathon last year in mizuno wave inspire 11s and found that there just wasn't enough cushion for the long ride. These are supportive and fit similarly to my feet in a 9. When you or them on the collar seems to be loose fitting above the heel but at pace they are glorious!!!
customer_reviews.author: cambridge_legend

customer_reviews.title: Very nice running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I got 400+ miles out of these before retiring them. I was pretty pleased with the shoes. They are a bit stiff - I've since moved to a more neutral shoe from Saucony. But, they held-up very well and gave me almost no problems. I'm 220lbs with low arches and a bit of a supinator. The Guide is one of the best shoes I've tried (had the 7, a couple of the 8s and this pair). There is a bit more stability than what I would like, but think anyone looking for mild support would really enjoy this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit - love the shoe so comfortable UNTIL
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the shoes started to come apart at the top of the back heel and left blisters on both my heels. Purchased for $69.99 on February 24, 2017 and by the first of May I can't wear the shoes. The Return window closed on 3-26-17 - very disappointed - finally found the perfect shoes and they don't last 3 months. Only wore these shoes to the YMCA 2 to 3 times a week. Would very much appreciate Amazon stepping up to the plate by replacing the shoes
customer_reviews.author: Wanda C. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great comfy shoes for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes I ever purchased! I bought these in a men's size 10 2E. I normally wear a woman's 11 wide. But these fit me so well. The sole has a lot of support and bounce to it so that by the end of the day my legs and feet so not swell and hurt. I'll definitely be buying more Saucony .....
customer_reviews.author: Alabama Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My dad normally wears a 9 1/2 and he needed to get a size 10 and it fits perfect. He is a runner in the summer time. Location can vary from street to track. Lately the shoes he has worn have become uncomfortable, get him tired, or causes cramps in his legs. With his first run he noticed the difference on all three of those things. He said "he thinks he found his new favorite shoe"
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but fall apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a year and a half ago. Loved them at first, they are a very comfortable shoe. I only wore them 2 or 3 times a month after a year I noticed the bottom of my shoe was catching on something. After looking a little closer I realized the bottom treads were literally coming off. If I wore these everyday then that wouldn’t be as bad, but since I wear them so infrequently, they are a complete disappointed. Not well made.
customer_reviews.author: Ordubismom

customer_reviews.title: Great XC training shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my son's xc training. We went to a shoe specialist who after evaluating his stride and arches recommended these for him to run in. He LOVES them! This is his first year running XC and truly appreciates these training shoes. He's been putting up the fastest times on his team and doing so comfortably. We saved over $40 dollars buying these on amazon vs the local running store. We also picked up a pair of saucony spikes with the money we saved and still came out ahead. This is a great running shoe if you're look for something with great stability and moderate pronation. Very good cushioning if you're a heal striker like he is.
customer_reviews.author: J-Mann

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of running shoes and I can say I haven't had any issue with them at all. I have run about 15 miles per week in them and have held up for about 5 months so far with barely any wear. Very comfortable, and my feet are the last thing on my body to get tired during a jog, but I haven't gone longer than 6 miles in one session so I cannot comment on longer runs. I run almost exclusively on cement/asphalt. Will most certainly look to Saucony again once it's time to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Incomparable quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased these for my 14 year old son to use in track, but once the season was over they became his daily wear shoes (he is growing rapidly and so they would have been set aside eventually and getting good use out of them made better sense). They were his favorite shoes to date and held up to his very abusive ways. I love Saucony shoes myself and these definitely did not disappoint. We will buy him a new pair of Saucony shoes next year for track without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Seraphim

customer_reviews.title: After trying all three on at my local sporting goods store I found these to be the best fit, offered the best support
customer_reviews.text: I was in between choosing these, Brooks Launch 2, or my go-to shoe for the past 2 years, Asics Gel Kayano (the 22 being the newest model at the time of this review). After trying all three on at my local sporting goods store I found these to be the best fit, offered the best support, and they are noticeably lighter than my older Kayano 21s. Great purchase and arrived on time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they run small. I had to re-order a half-size bigger.
customer_reviews.text: when I get my size 10's I'll have a better review. I always order 9.5, so I was a bit surprised to have to order 10. So, just know that if you're a fan of this model they may run small. I'm looking forward to my size 10's to see if I'll like these as much as my Guide 7's. These did seem a bit stiffer on the midsole than I'm used to, but we'll see over time if that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Nibby

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I was a huge fan of thee Guide 8, but the guide 9 seems to be lacking in several areas. It is not as soft as the guide 8, making it a less forgiving for log distance running. It also lacks the depth in the heel that the guide 8 has. I have switched to other shoes that give more comfort and support. I like the guide 8 much better, and I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. No injury running
customer_reviews.text: These are great running shoes for those who need the extra support due to pronation. I took my first pair of Guide 9 shoes nearly 600 miles before replacing. These are my second pair and I plan to go about 600 miles again. No injuries - favorite Saucony shoes so far! I just wish Saucony could do something a bit different with their design as I think Brooks, Nike, and other companies beat them in that department. But for fit and ride, I love the Saucony Guide shoes.
customer_reviews.author: T-rap

customer_reviews.title: Will recommend for people with flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for running. I particularly recommend for people with flat feet like me. Decided on this particular model after doing quite a bit of research. My only comment is that it has a wide toe box. Other than than, great looking and comfortable running shoes. I run about 3 to 4 miles weekly on the road and also on the treadmill, I had to break them in a little, but now they are very comfortable. Will continue to buy the Saucony Guide.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. McFly

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as other Guide models!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was a big disappointment. Saucony keeps changing their shoes so you never know what you are getting in a new model. The Guide 9 is very narrow in the toe box and not a comfortable shoe as other models. Saucony seems to be using cheaper materials but charging higher pricers. Buyer beware! I have worn Sauconys for years and have liked many of the Guide and Ride models but the Guide 9 is definitely not an improvement on previous models. If you have worn a Guide 6 or 7, I would recommend buying those instead of the Guide 9.
customer_reviews.author: Epaphras

customer_reviews.title: Good to very good not great
customer_reviews.text: This a good to very good shoe but not great Pros: Nice overall fit Great forefront padding Looks nice very light Cons: It feels like your heels slips out when walking not a big issue when running I prefer more stability in a shoe and this was lacking in this dept I didnt hinder or help my performance
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I will change my rating in the near future. I've only got a few miles in. These see my first pair Saucony. I always buy my running shoes a half size bigger so mine were an 11. 5 they did feel a bit snug in the front even with the half size up for myself. I absolutely know a size 12 would have been far too roomy and that's not what you want in a running shoe. So far I would compare the fit to an Asics gel Kyano (20, 21).
customer_reviews.author: bronxty

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: The Guide 9 are the best -- most comfortable -- running shoes I've ever had. I've had other Saucony models before, along with New Balance, Brooks, Adidas, Nike. I did not know what "energy return" was before the Guide 9. The squishy bouncy soles are like fuel when running -- they help me power on. I recently got a pair of the Guide 10 -- they are not as good as the 9. If you want a top-notch, comfortable running shoe, get the Guide 9 before they sell out.
customer_reviews.author: Zon Alum

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, a bit tight in some places.
customer_reviews.text: Fits ok, a bit tighter than I would've expected, but I wouldn't say it is too small. The stretchy laces take some getting used to. I have about 70 miles in these shoes and they seem to be doing fine. I have some pain on my left big toe joint on the foot where I feel the shoe pressing. But they are comfortable. I really do like the padding on these shoes. They've gone with me on many few mile road runs up through a 15 mile trail run. They've held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: pwlk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: These work well for my needs af a slightly larger toe box, arch support and probation step. They are also holding up well to gym abuse, running etc. I work out 3-4 days a week in these shoes with an average of 6-8 mikes of running. The soles last well, I wear them out at the sides of the widest part of the foot first. I would buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: torsten palm

customer_reviews.title: Good for a stability shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really like the Guide series, though I'm not positive I like the 9's quite as much as the 8's. After a couple hours of wearing these, my feet feel a bit cramped in them. I don't have wide feet, so not sure what's up. I consider these comparative to the Brooks Ravenna, though I like that these only have an 8mm drop instead of the Ravenna's 10mm.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: The older model was better
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Guide 8 set, felt great, right out of the box. I signed up for a half- marathon, ordered a set of Guide 9s, and didn't get that great new shoe feel I got from the previous model. They just felt like running shoes... After putting about a hundred miles into the new ones, I threw my old ones back on, and got the " these are great shoes" feeling again. My Guide 8s are still nicer to run in than these new ones.
customer_reviews.author: E4A6L7

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Saucony for a long time but it's been about two years since I've purchased a new pair. I ordered a 9 1/2 wide which is what I've used before and it feels perfect. The sizing doesn't seem to have changed at all. This is the first time I have tried a pair with the ever run cushioning and it really feels great. I've used them on a treadmill and found them to be really good for that. The quality seems to be on part with my older sauconys and hopefully they'll last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: moebius

customer_reviews.title: but these work great for me
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are a tough review, because they are specific to the runner, but these work great for me. I get shin splints and overpronate, and need a stability shoe - these offer exactly what I need, and are extremely comfortable. Prior to the Guide 9 I owned a pair of Guide 8s. Functionally, I notice little difference.
customer_reviews.author: C. Liotta

customer_reviews.title: Same Guide Quality As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Guide running shoes for the last 4 or 5 years and these hold up to what I expect out of a well made running shoe with good cushioning and support. They take a run or two to break in (all running shoes do), but once broken in they definitely hold up to my 6 mile runs. I got the Lime color and it is super bright in person, but that is what I wanted (I like bright colors for my workout gear).
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: This shoes r super super comfy
customer_reviews.text: This shoes r super super comfy,they look narrow when u try them on but I think it's design that way for stability,one more thing to note is that I'm 9 1/2 shoes but soucony run a bit small that's y I bought size 10 instead. For the past 10 years asics were my favorite shoes to wear but now soucony took the throne,,,,,thank u soucony team u r truly the best!!!
customer_reviews.author: PAUL C.

customer_reviews.title: but it's awesome. My chiropractor prescribed me a stability shoe with ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the honeymoon period, but it's awesome. My chiropractor prescribed me a stability shoe with an 8mm heel to toe drop. This fit the bill for an awesome price. Fits great. Very comfortable. My knee kind of feels better already. I had been wearing very unsupportive flat shoes after wearing a dress shoe all day. I would buy them again. Actually, I may buy them again while they're cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, wearing well, perfect for my gait
customer_reviews.text: These are authentic and very comfortable Saucony's. I went to a local store and they suggested another brand after running in these for a few years, and I quickly realized that was a mistake. These are great for my stride length and gait, and are getting me through the training that I'm doing for my first half marathon! Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bendy (Ben and Randy)

customer_reviews.title: They are like the perfected girlfriend, supportive, comforting and make you feel light on your feet
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Saucony for 5 years now. I am a 12 mile a week runner. These shoes felt a bit tight to start with but I wore them around the house and the broke in over a day. After my first 2 runs with them on I had some shin pain but since then they are like the perfected girlfriend, supportive, comforting and make you feel light on your feet. I'd recommend. Size fit was dead on with Guide 9.
customer_reviews.author: Negative Externality

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Guide 9
customer_reviews.text: I love my Saucony Guide 9 shoes , great shoes , great price , purchased two pair . Will buy a third pair when they go back on sale . Not saying they are the very best running shoe , but they should be in that conversation along with Brooks and Asics . Update , I now have purchased my third pair of the guide 9 shoes . Couldn't be more pleased with them , they are light on my feet and very comfortable . Saucony makes quality running shoes . I did read the reviews and ordered 1\2 size larger , and got a near perfect fit .
customer_reviews.author: Norman G. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Dream Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Like running on clouds. I didn't intend to, but I wear these as my normal shoes they are so nice. I can't say anything to the claims of helping runner's cramps. I don't get these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Egon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing. I wear them at work, where I walk about 6-7 miles every shift and on my feet the majority of the 12 hour shift. When I leave work, my feet hurt very little to none now! Before I had these shoes, I'd leave work barely bring able to walk in my Nikes. I would recommend these shoes to anyone who stands for a long period of time and walks a lot at work!
customer_reviews.author: MaleRN17

customer_reviews.title: but i think it was very comfortable in terms of cushioning my foot and the feeling ...
customer_reviews.text: actually ended up trading in for a size 8.5 2E Saucony Men's Grid Cohesion 10 because this Guide 9 felt a little narrow and long for my feet. but i think it was very comfortable in terms of cushioning my foot and the feeling I had while walking in it. it felt lightweight and easy to run in. The Grid Cohesion 10 ended up fitting perfectly and was very similar in terms of the qualities i mentioned earlier for the Guide 9.
customer_reviews.author: asdf

customer_reviews.title: I went with a size 10 rather than 9. ...
customer_reviews.text: I went with a size 10 rather than 9.5 and a D width. Never know what to expect when buying shoes either online or in a store. The sizes seem to vary from shoe to shoe. These feel a little tight (as all new shoes do to me)., but I think they will work out.
customer_reviews.author: Don C Webb

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of these that I have used. They are a great deal when on sale and are super comfortable. I can throw them on and run 10+ miles without having to break them in first and I have been getting roughly 150-180 miles out of each pair which is good for a person my size.
customer_reviews.author: SD Funk

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Fit nicely on the arch and uppers but needs some breaking in around the achilles tendon area on the heel (getting a little abrasion now but no blister). Love the foot strike with this shoe though and it keeps me coming back. This is the fourth pair I've purchased. They generally fall apart at the top of the back (at the achilles heel contact point) first but a little slick duct tape on that spot gets them through to when the tread wears down on the heel. I generally get a full year out of them at 20-25 miles per week.
customer_reviews.author: Vanonymous

customer_reviews.title: Glad I did not return them
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of the Guide and purchased these assuming the fit would remain relatively consistent. However I planned on returning the shoes due to a tight fit (initially) around the toe box. After stashing the shoes away for about 4 weeks, missing the return deadline (oops) and before donating them I give them one last try by wearing the shoes around the house. It took about 2 weeks but the shoes became more and more comfortable. They are now firmly part of my shoe rotation. I'm a bigger runner and the Guide provides good cushioning and support.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Very good cushioning. They were a little stiff the first few runs, but give it time and they'll loosen up. I run around 5-10 miles a week, so they're good for what I need. I previous wore ASICS Men's GEL-Kayano 19 and ASICS Men's Gel-DS Trainer 18 running shoes, and picked these up because I found a good deal on them.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for larger runners
customer_reviews.text: These shoes came recommended for heavier persons. They live up to that promise. As a bonus they are very light, at least when taken into consider their level of cushion. The arch support is good. The inside of the shoe fits the contour of my feet excellently. I often wear them at the gym and working around the house when they proved comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Lokken

customer_reviews.title: Best Guide yet
customer_reviews.text: IMO, this is the best guide yet. I hated the Guide 8's, as there was too much buildup under the ball of the foot which would cause me pain while running. The "everrun" continuous cushioning works better for me than the "more separate heel and toe" cushioning of the previous models.
customer_reviews.author: trailmug

customer_reviews.title: Good stabilty running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to running shoes after Saucony changed the Hurricane too much and they no longer worked for me. I hate it when that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D. Hamernick

customer_reviews.title: Great stability shoe,so li d but light
customer_reviews.text: For a 250 lbs solid guy this is an excellent shoe, supportive and cushion plentry, not bouncy. First pair of Saucony and im happy. Will migrate from New Balances 870s, also great stability shoes, but very flimsy. Had 3 pairs break, unglue in the same spot. Hope Saucys are better, especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: sambazon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm flat footed and have trouble finding shoes with arches that don't feel like I'm stepping on half a super ball. These are great. Have over 100 miles of running in them so far without any trouble. Planning to buy another pair before they get taken off the market.
customer_reviews.author: cappleby

customer_reviews.title: One of the best running shoes I have owned
customer_reviews.text: 5 x 5k and still going strong. One of the best running shoes I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: CS Programmer

customer_reviews.title: Sacuony Gets It Right
customer_reviews.text: I'm an 11.5 but can wear a 12 if the shoe is on the large side. This is the second pair of Saucony Guide shoes I've bought (first was the Guide 7), and both pairs have fit 11.5 perfectly. Also, excellent "toe box," and a snug but comfortable fit for rest of foot. A first rate running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: F. K. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: The men's shoe fits me better than the women's version of the same Guide
customer_reviews.text: I only wear Saucony shoes. The men's shoe fits me better than the women's version of the same Guide. Plus, I like the bright colors that are not offered in the women's line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes for those who have a collapsed arch
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes for those who have a collapsed arch. Stability-type shoes with lots of padding beneath foot. Very good for running on road and track. They fit me very well but I went to a shoe store and tried them out first, and I would recommend any perspective buyers do the same if they can. Excellent for those who suffer from foot pain in regular running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Najib and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable and fit well
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and fit well. I have only used them to run in once, but they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joel D. Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: I really like this sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Saucony is my brand so when I buy their shoes I typically know the fit. The sneaker needs a few miles of breaking in but when you've arrived- it's a terrific runner. If you've never worn Saucony, I would buy your size and the 1/2 size up. I like a snug fit and although I would like to think I'm still a kid...I'm all done growing!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Harrington

customer_reviews.title: I really like the feel of the G9's
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel of the G9's, but for a EE width I was a little disappointed, the forefoot is a little more snug than I wanted. They feel more like a wide D in other brands. Otherwise they have become my go to running shoes and have been very comfortable to run in after I did some extra stretching of the material in the toe box. I did change the laces out to LockLaces, they were just a bit too long for me.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Son last December. He has preferred Saucony for a while and he loves these shoes. He's 6'4" and 220, so they take a gravity beating. His feet are wide he has a high instep, and the medium width fits good.
customer_reviews.author: raterguy

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion but too narrow for my duck feet. If you have wide feet, get a half size larger and 2E width.
customer_reviews.text: These have about as much cushioning as the Triumph ISO 2. I wear a size 9 in Nike tennis and running shoes. I have wide feet and I find that Saucony generally run narrow compared to Nike. I had to get a size 9.5 2E for my Saucony Triumph ISO 2. Amazon did not have these Guide 9 in 9.5 2E so I tried just 9.5. Unfortunately it was still too narrow otherwise I would have kept them. It was a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Son Tran

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite Guide model so far and I started with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The Guide 9 provides more cushion over the Guide 8. This is my favorite Guide model so far and I started with the Guide 6. I always buy a half size bigger than my normal shoe size with the Guide models.
customer_reviews.author: TrabucoG

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy fabric above toes
customer_reviews.text: Good for running (I had to add Superfeet insole but that's my problem, not the shoe's), but the fabric above the toe is way too flimsy. I had a hole above my big toe after just two months, and I'm only running 10 miles a week.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dvorak

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are great, but MUCH SMALLER than previous Guides.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are great, but MUCH SMALLER than previous Guides. I ordered a half size larger and they fit well... just a smidge of extra room. One star for the fit compared to previous versions... four stars for the fit when I size up. Zero stars for having to order twice. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: These shoes lasted me over a year and I am ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes lasted me over a year and I am very hard on a pair of shoes. I wore them almost daily to work and a rather large guy.
customer_reviews.author: scott shedden

customer_reviews.title: ... prior version of this shoe and this version is better. It seems to have all significant features of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several prior version of this shoe and this version is better. It seems to have all significant features of the newly released guide 10 but you can get this one much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D Springer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp colored running shoes
customer_reviews.text: My son has been purchasing Saucony running shoes for several years now as they seem to be the only brand that fits his feet well. He likes the bright red color as a change from the colors he's had previously.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Toe holes
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of this shoe and love them however, after less than 80 miles the tops of the shoes wore out at the toe area. I have never had this happen. I am a marathon runner with no toenails due to my running.
customer_reviews.author: Joni P

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe will keep buying Guide shoes by Saucony
customer_reviews.text: Read shoe I have been buying this Series by Saucony for years. I’m a heavier weight runner so I need a shoe with more stability and support. This one works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: too loose fitting
customer_reviews.text: replaced guide 6, which are perfect. Guide 9 is too wide at front of foot for me, and stability (pronation) not right over arches. Maybe if I moved 1/2 size less than normal size it would, but don't want to start messing around with nomal size.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Laskov

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes - but a little too narrow for me...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these and a pair of NB Vazee Prism at the same time. I have a wide foot and these Sauconys are a little too narrow. They seem to be well made and are fine for a few hours. I would love them if they were a little wider.
customer_reviews.author: bruceindfw

customer_reviews.title: Quality feeling shoe, but runs small and little arch support.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a very high quality shoe as I tried this along with the Omni 14 along side it. They seem to run slightly smaller than Mizuno and Nike though. And they don't seem to have much arch support. So, if you have a higher arch, I'd probably recommend another brand or try throwing a new pair of insoles in these.
customer_reviews.author: Lolz69

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Run 70+ a week. Added these shoes to my rotation. I rotate between the Omni, Mizuno Wave Inspire, Newton Kismet, and now these shoes. I've only worn these for a ten mile run so far (will update if any problems), but can tell they are a comfortable stability shoe. Can't say how they will feel once broken in, but I haven't been disappointed with Saucony yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I switched from Asics to Saucony. They fit perfect, very comfortable, and I could run for days with these shoes. I love the color, and the support it gives me with my bad knees. I am going to run half marathon in two months. These shoes will help me train and succeed to accomplish half marathon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe, but got a misfit.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product four stars because I bought the same shoe in a different color a few weeks before and they are super comfortable, however this pair didn't fit as well and were too tight. So, I sent the gray pair back and ordered the blue hoping this one pair was an anomaly.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny O

customer_reviews.title: STABILITY SUPPORT  / COMFY / Good for beginner shoe
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind this is a STABILITY shoe. According to the Saucony's rating scale, it's high on the support scale, not ideal if you're looking for a minimal - neutral sole. However, it's fit is spot on. I have an average to narrow foot, I've found Saucony is a good fit for my foot architecture. Highly recommend for comfort and support, not recommended for runners trying to feel the ground below.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my hubs and he loves them. This is his second pair. His old ones were 2 years old and have been through a couple hundred miles of running lol. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R.

customer_reviews.title: Too small in the toe area.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased only Saucony running shoes for the past 5 years and they have fit perfectly every time except this shoe. I have been able to confidently order these shoes online with a perfect fit but these are terribly tight in the front of the shoe where my toes begin. Saucony, please keep your product consistent.
customer_reviews.author: TravisInternational

customer_reviews.title: Great all around running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Husband ordered these based on sale price, look, and known fit. He owned the same pair in the prior model. Fit was just as described and same as last model. Comfort good. Colors could be better but pricing outweighed decision.
customer_reviews.author: katstan

customer_reviews.title: Second pair of Saucony Guides I've purchased because I love these. I started out with a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Saucony Guides I've purchased because I love these. I started out with a different brand, and though I still use that other type of shoe to have two different pairs, these are definitely my favorites now.
customer_reviews.author: John Cameron Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Guide 9 is my magic running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Best shoe for me. Guide 9 is my magic running shoes. I have 4 pair in various colors because Saucony is now going with the Guide 10.
customer_reviews.author: RUSH2112

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. The first Saucony shoes I have tried and my first experience with Everrun soles. They are comfortable and relatively well balanced. I look forward to future versions.
customer_reviews.author: jack-2

customer_reviews.title: To Narrow!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought these shoes from a running store before and loved them... they are fantastic comfortable running shoes. The only issue is these ones from Amazon run a little tighter than the other pair I bought. Not sure how that happened, but it is quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome shoes. Very comfortable, stable, and cushioned. Size runs just slightly small, almost a half size small. Some will be okay with their normal size, others will need a half size larger. I recommend going to a shoe store and trying them on.
customer_reviews.author: Daegun Bong

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: The Ride 9’s fit like slippers, love these shoes and highly recommend them. The Ride 10 model, they reduced volume in the toe box and the shoe wasn’t the same.
customer_reviews.author: Blues&Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Loved the Gift
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift to my husband. He had hip replacements a couple of years ago and it's hard to find shoes that allow him to walk longer distances without causing him pain. He loves these and is about to wear them for longer times.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for running
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for running, I did my best marathon time with them and didn't had any blisters or any problems when I finished it Excellent quality and materials
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright shoes for feet.
customer_reviews.text: Really cool shoes; bright color and very comfortable. This is probably my 10th-12th pair of Sauconys and this pair is one of the most comfortable pairs I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy E Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had read a lot before I purchased my first set of running shoes. Though I felt a bit stress at the toe when I initially wore the shoe soon got adjusted to my feet and adapted and my feet could breathe comfortably. The shoe has a thick base giving comfort when you land each time. Also it looks pleasing to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Anoop Mohan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amount of cushioning for both walking and on runs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect amount of cushioning for both walking and on runs. Just as importantly for me, very breathable material. So far has been very comfortable and find myself wearing them throughout the whole day.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Material tears easily
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a high school cross country runner and having to replace them after just a few months of use due to the material tearing on the outside of the shoes near the little toe. It's disappointing since other than that, they held up well, but can't very well run 50 miles a week and a race every weekend with half your foot hanging out! Replacing with a different brand. Saucony should reconsider the design pattern of the mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Tapscott

customer_reviews.title: Great stability shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good stability shoe. Stable ride that is noce for training. I prefer a bit more drop, but am adjusting to these and liking them. Very durable-I’ve logged plenty of miles, and they’ve worn nicely.
customer_reviews.author: G McCool

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes a lot. Do more workouts in them than just running. Find the fit is good and the quality has been great through two pairs.
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoComments

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Great fitting, good arch support, all around amazing shoe. Saucony never disappoints. I've tried every brand known to man during my search for the perfect shoe and Saucony meets all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: LarryV

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe! Not a fan of the price going up!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Weller

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Guides all the way
customer_reviews.text: I've wore saucony guides for the last 4 years. This show is excellent and lasts a fairly good time compared to other shoes
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: This is the absolute best running shoe you can get if you run more ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best running shoe you can get if you run more than one mile at a time it has a lot of bounce back witch is good if you want to get faster. the shoe itself however is not ascetically pleasing in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Anastacio

customer_reviews.title: The price was awesome as well
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves Saucony and this is the edition he wears. The price was awesome as well. Priced way less than the running stores my husband visits.
customer_reviews.author: Misy

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy those
customer_reviews.text: After using the Guide 9 I decided to buy two more pairs of Guide 10. It's really good in almost every aspect: Weight, stability, cushy. Highly recommended, especially since Saucony have a fair price (I'm Ex Kayano user)
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I love the support from the Saucony Guide shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the support from the Saucony Guide shoes. I have flat feet and have suffered from plantar fasciitis in the past. These shoes give my arches great support and are wide enough for someone with fairly wide feet too.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Premium trainer.
customer_reviews.text: I run 100-150 miles a month. This shoe will get me 3-4 months of running. Premium shoe at a not so premium price.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Jones

customer_reviews.title: It's not as soft and comfortable, but I've only run one time so far ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been running with Saucony shoes for many years. But the soul insert is a little different than usual. It's not as soft and comfortable, but I've only run one time so far for an hour, so maybe it will get softer, or I'll get used to it. But I've always loved Saucony, so all the other issues are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DEPENDABLE
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the Saucony Guide for many years. I recently purcahsed the latest edition Guide 10. I was greatly disappointed in the fit and feel while running. I decided to purchase the Guide 9 again. As before it is a much better fit and feel that the Guide 10.
customer_reviews.author: T. B. Koch

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for my brother who was having a difficult time finding a shoe he liked that didn't alter his strike pattern to wh
customer_reviews.text: Solid running shoe, exactly what I expected out of a Saucony shoe. I bought these for my brother who was having a difficult time finding a shoe he liked that didn't alter his strike pattern to where it hurt to run. this shoe fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: W C

customer_reviews.title: The color (blue) is good, but I wish there were more colors in ...
customer_reviews.text: Classic Suacony comfort. Fits really well. The color (blue) is good, but I wish there were more colors in a wide width available.
customer_reviews.author: jcampbell474

customer_reviews.title: Update not good
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the 9s. I have used the 6,7 and 8 but the 9s are different seem to have a different offset from the toe to the heel. Still says 8mm but it feels lower. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: they were the best running shoes I ever owned - comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same shoes a year ago from a running store while preparing for a half marathon....they were the best running shoes I ever owned - comfortable, light, supportive and long-wearing. I paid $120 for my first pair from a running store. Since I already knew the size fit me correctly and worked as I wanted, I found these on Amazon for $80 and took advantage of the price break. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Nattyshane

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a Christmas gift. He loved them. The fit was nice and the color was what he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas1964

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Guide 9 Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: The saucony guide 9 has a dual density medial post and full length everun cushion. Smoother transition thanks to the src landing zone. The guide 9's moisture-wicking, rundry lining helps against sweat and irritations. The lightweight flexfilm provides a seamless flexible feel, while the ssl eva midsole maximises rebound and durability. The tri-flex outsole works with the everun topsole for increased dispersion and is also delivering optimal flexibility and traction.
feature_bullets: FLEXFILM no-sew overlays, RUNDRY lining, EVERUN topsole construction, Dual Density for pronation control, TRI-FLEX outsole design for improved flexibility.
